snippet.title: Inclusive searches for squarks and gluinos in events with leptons, jets and missing transverse momentum with the ATLAS detector
snippet.description: Inclusive searches for squarks and gluinos in events with leptons, jets and missing transverse momentum with the ATLAS detector / Mueller, T (Johannes Gutenberg Universitaet Mainz) In presence of long decay chains that may occur in gluino pair production at the LHC, R-parity conserving supersymmetry can be revealed by searching for final states with leptons produced along with jets and significant missing transverse momentum. The talk summarises recent results on inclusive searches for supersymmetric squarks and gluinos in events containing electron, muon or tau leptons, jets and missing transverse momentum. [...] ATL-PHYS-SLIDE-2012-747.- Geneva : CERN, 2012 Fulltext: PDF; External link: Original Communication (restricted to ATLAS) In : 20th International Conference on Supersymmetry and Unification of Fundamental Interactions, Peking Univ., Beijing, China, 13 - 18 Aug 2012

snippet.title: Linux Command Line and Shell Scripting Bible
snippet.description: Linux Command Line and Shell Scripting Bible . \- 2nd ed. / Blum, Richard The authoritative guide to Linux command line and shell scripting?completely updated and revised [it's not a guide to Linux as a whole ? just to scripting] The Linux command line allows you to type specific Linux commands directly to the system so that you can easily manipulate files and query system resources, thereby permitting you to automate commonly used functions and even schedule those programs to run automatically [...] Hoboken, NJ : John Wiley & Sons, 2011. - 1581 p. (Bible ; 747)

snippet.title: Evidence for $\eta_{c} \rightarrow \gamma\gamma$ and Measurement of $J/\psi\rightarrow 3\gamma$
snippet.description: Evidence for $\eta_{c} \rightarrow \gamma\gamma$ and Measurement of $J/\psi\rightarrow 3\gamma$ / BESIII Collaboration The decay of $J/\psi$ to three photons is studied using $\psi^\prime\to\pi^+\pi^-J/\psi$ in a sample of 106 million $\psi^\prime$ events collected with the BESIII detector. [...] arXiv:1208.1461. \- 2012\. Preprint

snippet.title: Comments on knotted 1/2 BPS Wilson loops
snippet.description: Comments on knotted 1/2 BPS Wilson loops / Tanaka, Akinori In this paper, we show that the localization of three-dimensional N = 2 supersymmetric Chern-Simons theory on the ellipsoid-like squashed sphere is related to a nontrivial knot structure called torus knot. [...] arXiv:1204.5975 ; OU-HET 747. \- 2012\. Preprint

snippet.title: On the Three-dimensional Central Moment Lattice Boltzmann Method
snippet.description: On the Three-dimensional Central Moment Lattice Boltzmann Method / Premnath, Kannan N ; Banerjee, Sanjoy A three-dimensional (3D) lattice Boltzmann method based on central moments is derived. Two main elements are the local attractors in the collision term and the source terms representing the effect of external and/or self-consistent internal forces. [...] arXiv:1202.6081.- 2012 - 55 p. \- Published in : Pages 74 (2011) 7-794 External link: Preprint

snippet.title: Asteroseismology of the Nearby SN-II Progenitor: Rigel Part I. The MOST High Precision Photometry and Radial Velocity Monitoring
snippet.description: Asteroseismology of the Nearby SN-II Progenitor: Rigel Part I. The MOST High Precision Photometry and Radial Velocity Monitoring / Moravveji, Ehsan ; Guinan, Edward F ; Shultz, Matt ; Williamson, Michael H ; Moya, Andres Rigel (beta Ori, B8 Ia) is a nearby blue supergiant displaying alpha Cyg type variability, and is one of the nearest type-II supernova progenitors. [...] arXiv:1201.0843. \- 2012\. Preprint

snippet.title: CLASH: Discovery of a Bright $z\simeq6.2$ Dwarf Galaxy Quadruply Lensed by MACS J0329.6-0211
snippet.description: CLASH: Discovery of a Bright $z\simeq6.2$ Dwarf Galaxy Quadruply Lensed by MACS J0329.6-0211 / Zitrin, A ; Moustakas, J ; Bradley, L ; Coe, D ; Moustakas, L A ; Postman, M ; Shu, X ; Zheng, W ; Benítez, N ; Bouwens, R et al. We report the discovery of a $z_{phot}=6.18^{+0.05}_{-0.07}$ (95% confidence level) dwarf galaxy, lensed into four images by the galaxy cluster MACS J0329.6-0211 ($z_{l}=0.45$). [...] arXiv:1111.5006. \- 2011\. Preprint

snippet.title: K^0-\bar{K}^0 mixing in the Standard Model from Nf=2+1+1 Twisted Mass Lattice QCD
snippet.description: K^0-\bar{K}^0 mixing in the Standard Model from Nf=2+1+1 Twisted Mass Lattice QCD / Carrasco, N ; Gimenez, V ; Dimopoulos, P ; Frezzotti, R ; Palao, D ; Rossi, G C ; Lubicz, V ; Papinutto, M ; Sanfilippo, F ; Simula, S We present preliminary results at {\beta} = 1.95 (a = 0.077 fm) on the first unquenched N_f=2+1+1 lattice computation of the B_K parameter which controls the neutral kaon oscillations in the Standard Model. [...] arXiv:1111.1262 ; IFIC-11-62. \- 2011\. Preprint

snippet.title: An acoustically-driven biochip - Impact of flow on the cell-association of targeted drug carriers
snippet.description: An acoustically-driven biochip - Impact of flow on the cell-association of targeted drug carriers / Fillafer, Christian ; Ratzinger, Gerda ; Neumann, Jürgen ; Guttenberg, Zeno ; Dissauer, Silke ; Lichtscheidl, Irene ; Wirth, Michael ; Gabor, Franz ; Schneider, Matthias The interaction of targeted drug carriers with epithelial and endothelial barriers in vivo is largely determined by the dynamics of the body fluids. To simulate these conditions in binding assays, a fully biocompatible in vitro model was developed which can accurately mimic a wide range of physiological flow conditions on a thumbnail-format cell-chip. [...] arXiv:1107.5206.- 2011 - 19 p. \- Published in : Lab on a Chip 9 (2009) 8 External link: Preprint

snippet.title: Status of the Stratospheric Observatory for Infrared Astronomy (SOFIA)
snippet.description: Status of the Stratospheric Observatory for Infrared Astronomy (SOFIA) / Gehrz, R D ; Becklin, E E ; de Buizer, J ; Herter, T ; Keller, L D ; Krabbe, A ; Marcum, P M ; Roellig, T L ; Sandell, G H L ; Temi, P et al. The Stratospheric Observatory for Infrared Astronomy (SOFIA), a joint U.S./German project, is a 2.5-meter infrared airborne telescope carried by a Boeing 747-SP that flies in the stratosphere at altitudes as high as 45,000 feet (13.72 km) [...] arXiv:1102.1050. \- 2011\. Preprint
